description: A general category for various diseases.
A malignant tumor that originates from breast cells.
Cancer that forms in the tissues of the lung.
Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland of males.
Cancer of the colon or rectum, part of the digestive tract.
Cancer that begins in the ovaries, the female reproductive organs.
Large biomolecules essential for structure and function in cells.
A tumor suppressor protein involved in preventing cancer.
A protein that can promote the growth of cancer cells.
Epidermal growth factor receptor, involved in cell growth.
Vascular endothelial growth factor, stimulates blood vessel growth.
A gene associated with increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer.
Segments of DNA that code for proteins and traits.
A gene that codes for the p53 protein, crucial in cancer prevention.
A gene linked to higher risk of breast and ovarian cancer.
A gene involved in cell signaling pathways, often mutated in cancer.
Substances used in or produced by chemical processes.
A drug used to treat and prevent breast cancer.
A monoclonal antibody used to treat HER2-positive breast cancer.
A chemotherapy drug used to treat various cancers.
An anthracycline antibiotic used in cancer chemotherapy.
A chemotherapy agent and immune system suppressant.
Substances used to diagnose, treat, or prevent diseases.
An immunotherapy drug used to treat various cancers.
An immune checkpoint inhibitor used in cancer treatment.
A drug that inhibits angiogenesis, used to treat several cancers.
A monoclonal antibody for HER2-positive breast cancer.
A medication used to treat multiple myeloma and other conditions.
